pair.Prompt: In October 1903, Morgan and other defendants responded to a petition in the Northern Securities Co. v. United States case.
pair.Response: Response: The defendants denied each and every allegation of the petition, except for Paragraph XIV, which stated that the capital stock of the Northern Pacific Railway Company was fixed at $155,000,000, of which $75,000,000 were preferred and $80,000,000 common stock. They also stated that the Northern Pacific Company and the Great Northern Company each purchased about 49% of the capital stock of the Chicago, Burlington and Quincy Railroad Company. The case was heard on October 1903 and the case number was 193 U.S.
